metadata.Title: CVE-2022-25236 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5 allows attackers to insertnamespace-separator characters into namespace URIs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25236` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxmltok1 - 1.2-3ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
xmlrpc-c package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
vnc4 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
insighttoolkit package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
insighttoolkit4 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
ayttm package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
cableswig package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
coin3 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
vtk package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
libxmltok package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-3ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm2').
